definition: lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic
see 台灣葉鼻蝠|台湾叶鼻蝠[Tai2 wan1 Ye4 bi2 fu2]

sentences.english: Small pelagic fish often accompanying sharks or mantas.
sentences.chinese: 经常伴随鲨鱼和蝠鲼游动的远洋小鱼。

sentences.english: When I'd go out with the dinghy, manta ray would escort me, dolphins.
sentences.chinese: 当我划着小舢板出海时，蝠鲼和海豚会为我护航。

sentences.english: Ghost faced bats are widely spread in the New World, from the southern US to Peru.
sentences.chinese: 鬼脸蝠广泛分布在从美国南部到秘鲁的新大陆中。

sentences.english: It is a haven for  hammerhead and  white tip sharks, as well as  manta  rays.
sentences.chinese: 对于第鲨鱼和白尖鲨，以及蝠𫚉，这是一个避难所。

sentences.english: A greater spear-nosed bat hovers at a blossom.
sentences.chinese: 一只矛吻蝠悬停在一朵花上。

sentences.english: Unlike stingrays, manta rays do not have venomous tail barbs.
sentences.chinese: 和刺鳐不一样，蝠鲼没有剧毒的尾刺。

sentences.english: Spill-over of Hendra virus from fruit bats to horses is rare.
sentences.chinese: 亨德拉病毒从果蝠传播给马匹的情况很少见。

definition: a legendary dragon with the ability to control rain and floods/see also 蛟龍|蛟龙[jiao1 long2]
wild beast/wild horse/lion/trad. form used erroneously for 貌/simplified form used erroneously for 狻
